definition: to gather together, pool or collect/to happen by chance/to move close to/to exploit an opportunity
"water" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 85), occurring in 没, 法, 流 etc/see also 三點水|三点水[san1 dian3 shui3]
to play music/to achieve/to present a memorial to the emperor (old)
to bring together/to make do in a bad situation/to just get by/to improvise/passable/not too bad
to join in the fun/to get in on the action/(fig.) to butt in/to create more trouble
to raise enough money to do sth/to pool money/to club together (to do sth)
to serve as a stopgap/to make up a shortfall in the number of people
to pool resources (for a gift, project etc)
to comply in order to please others/to accommodate sb else's taste/to make fun of
to put together various bits/to knock sth together/hash (computing)/see also 散列[san3 lie4]
to put together hastily/to make do with

sentences.english: PUGILISTS and aesthetes are not necessarily in opposing corners.
sentences.chinese: 拳擊家和美學家未必就湊不到一塊兒。

sentences.english: Amused by her mock seriousness, I moved to her right breast.
sentences.chinese: 她的故作嚴肅真好玩，我就湊向她的右乳。

sentences.english: Mr Dedalus said. I was only vamping, man.
sentences.chinese: 迪達勒斯先生說，“夥計，我不過是湊湊熱鬧。”

sentences.english: Liu Chang reached over and pulled the coin from Tom's ear.
sentences.chinese: 劉暢湊過去，從湯姆的耳後拿出硬幣。

sentences.english: I'm going to Bermuda if I can find the money.
sentences.chinese: 如果湊得到錢，我就去百慕達。

sentences.english: The Cavaliers ' starting bigs are both teetering on the edge of oblivion.
sentences.chinese: 騎士的首發大個子湊處於逐漸被遺忘的邊緣。

sentences.english: There are not words enough in the unabridged to describe it.
sentences.chinese: 翻遍了全本的詞典也湊不夠詞來形容啊。

sentences.english: Lower your face over the cup, immersing your affected eye inside the water.
sentences.chinese: 把你的臉湊到杯子上，使受感染的眼睛在水中浸泡。

sentences.english: The room was darkening. he turned over towards the light and lay gazing into the glass paper weight.
sentences.chinese: 屋子裏開始發暗，他轉身湊着光亮，盯着玻璃鎮紙看。

sentences.english: Mama is very skillful in whipping up a meal at a moment's notice.
sentences.chinese: 媽媽善於現抓現湊，做出一頓飯來。

sentences.english: Her voice compelled me forward breathlessly as I listened.
sentences.chinese: 她的聲音使我身不由主地湊上前去屏息傾聽。

sentences.english: Let's hurry and join the fun now.
sentences.chinese: 那我們趕緊去湊湊熱鬧吧。

sentences.english: The likelihood is the something with little dribs and drabs, collect rises is an innovation.
sentences.chinese: 可能是點點滴滴小的一些東西，湊起來是一個創新。

sentences.english: Everything concurred in making him happy.
He lowered his voice and leaned closer, with his cigarette-stub stuck to his lower lip.
sentences.chinese: 他壓低聲音湊過來，香菸屁股沾在下嘴脣上。

sentences.english: The first Valborg's day was always most impressive.
sentences.chinese: 第一次湊的熱鬧總是讓人難忘的。

definition: farmstead/village/manor/place of business/banker (in a gambling game)/grave or solemn/holdings of a landlord (in imperial China)
flour/noodles/(of food) soft (not crunchy)/(slang) (of a person) ineffectual/spineless
soup/hot or boiling water/decoction of medicinal herbs/water in which sth has been boiled
to pay the bill/to settle accounts/also written 結帳|结帐
(computing) double pinyin (input method where the user types no more than two keystrokes per character, one for the initial and one for the final)
bird/CL:隻|只[zhi1],群[qun2]/(dialect) to pay attention to/(intensifier) damned/goddam
to record/to note/to memorize/to remember/mark/sign/classifier for blows, kicks, shots
